title: Namal responds to allegations of preferential treatment in law exam
byline: In response to the CID complaint filed by a civil society representative alleging that MP Namal Rajapaksa had received preferential treatment during a law examination 11 years ago, Rajapaksa said that there was no special treatment given to any candidate, including him.

title: AC Milan arrives in SL to launch three new Milan junior camps
byline: AC Milan announced the arrival of the Milan Junior Camp project in Sri Lanka, which will make stops in the cities of Colombo, Galle and Jaffna at the beginning of next year.

title: Membership of NOCSL decides on early elections
byline: The General Membership of the National Olympic Committee of Sri Lanka (NOCSL), during its Special General Assembly (SGA), resolved to conduct elections for new office-bearers no later than March 31, 2025.

title: Create formal institution to discuss sensitive info that BBS holds: Gnanasara Thera requests President
byline: Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) General Secretary, Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera, today requested the President to establish a formal institution to receive and discuss sensitive information they have collected regarding the growing racism and religious fanaticism in the country.

title: Cabinet Paper drafted to provide loans for restarting piggeries: Minister
byline: A Cabinet Paper has been drafted to provide concessionary loan facilities for farmers affected by disruptions to their piggeries by the spread of the African Swine Disease in the country, Agriculture and Livestock Deputy Minister Namal Karunaratne said.

title: Complaint filed against Namal Rajapaksa’s law exam
byline: A civil society representative has lodged a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) alleging that MP Namal Rajapaksa received preferential treatment during a law examination 11 years ago.

title: Sirisena assures Court: No future claims for SLFP chairmanship
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena, through his counsel, informed the Court of Appeal today that he will not claim any rights to the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) chairmanship in the future.

title: ’Won’t allow our land to be used against India’: President Anura Kumara
byline: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, on his first official trip to India, has assured Prime Minister Narendra Modi of full cooperation while ensuring regional peace. Dissanayake said that India has always helped Sri Lanka and the island nation has very significant place in the foreign policy of India.

title: Close to 1,000 feared dead after Cyclone Chido hits Mayotte
byline: Close to 1,000 people may have been killed after Cyclone Chido hit Mayotte in the Indian Ocean, according to the island’s top official.

title: Brigadier Medagoda appointed Army Media Director
byline: Brigadier M.J.R.S Medagoda assumed duties as the Sri Lanka Army’s Director of Media and Psychological Operations today.

title: Justice Minister files complaint with CID over false education data
byline: Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakkara has lodged a formal complaint with the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) today requesting an inquiry into the inclusion of inaccurate educational qualifications in the Parliament database.

title: President meets Modi
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake met Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at Hyderabad House this afternoon.

title: Hundreds feared dead after storm hits French territory
byline: The death toll in the French territory of Mayotte from Cyclone Chido is “several hundred” and may run into the thousands, the island’s top government official told a local broadcaster Sunday.

title: President receives ceremonial welcome at Rashtrapati Bhavan
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake was ceremonially welcomed by Indian President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi at Rashtrapati Bhavan this morning.

title: Govt. orders Acting IGP to curb shootings, underworld activity
byline: In the wake of a troubling rise in underworld activities and shooting incidents, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala told the Daily Mirror that he had directed the acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) to take swift action to curb the ongoing murders.

title: Four MPs sworn in
byline: Faizer Mustapha, Sujeewa Senasinghe, Mano Ganesan and Mohamed Ismail were sworn in as Members of Parliament (MPs) a short while ago before Deputy Speaker Rizvie Salih.

title: Jagath Wickramaratne elected as new Speaker
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) MP Jagath Wickramaratne was elected as the Speaker of the 10th Parliament.

title: Two killed by female student in shooting at US Christian school
byline: A student opened fire at a private Christian school in the US state of Wisconsin, injuring six people and killing a teacher and teenaged student.

title: November PMI signals continued expansion in manufacturing & services
byline: Sri Lanka’s economic activities across both the manufacturing and services activities continued to expand during November.

title: India will supply LNG to Sri Lanka’s power plants, announces PM Modi
byline: India plans to supply liquefied natural gas to Sri Lanka’s power plants and will work on connecting the power grids of the two countries as well as lay a petroleum pipeline between the neighbours, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced on Monday.

title: Will table educational qualifications in Parliament tomorrow: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said he will table all his education qualifications in the House tomorrow.

title: Total of 9,500 metric tons of rice imported, announces Customs
byline: The Sri Lanka Customs announced today that a total of 9,500 metric tons of rice has been imported into the country as of now.

title: Dr. Archchuna’s eligibility for Parliamentary seat challenged
byline: A writ petition has been filed before the Court of Appeal seeking an order declaring that Jaffna District Parliamentarian Dr. Ramanathan Archchuna is disqualified to be a Member of Parliament and is thus not entitled to hold office as a MP.

title: Biomedical engineer charged with corruption in procurement of 35 operating theater lamps
byline: The Colombo High Court today served indictments on a biomedical engineer attached to the Biomedical Engineering Unit of the Health Ministry for allegedly causing a financial loss to the government during the procurement of 35 operating theater lamps.

title: Egg producers hit by price drop due to over-production
byline: Egg producers have been affected by the price drop of eggs in the local market caused by high production, Sri Lanka Association of Animal Production president Ajith Gunasekera said.

title: Justice Minister calls for suspension of Parliament website until errors rectified
byline: Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakara today called for the suspension of the Parliament website until erroneous data with regard to MPs are corrected.

title: Deputy Speaker clarifies that he is not a specialist
byline: Deputy Speaker Rizvy Sally today clarified that he is not a specialist doctor and never used the title in his official letterheads, visiting cards and prescriptions.

title: Government to remove tri-forces security of former Presidents from next week
byline: The government has decided to remove the security provided by the tri-forces to former Presidents from next week, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said today.

title: IMF agreed to hold discussions on zoom; MP questions why officials visited Washington
byline: Opposition MP Chamara Sampath today questioned why the Central Bank and Finance Ministry officials visited Washington spending a colossal sum of money despite the International Monetary Fund (IMF)’s agreeing to hold discussions on its Extended Fund Facility (IMF) via zoom facility.

title: World Test Championship - State of Play ahead of 2025 final
byline: New Zealand finish their ICC World Test Championship 2025 campaign with a win over England but are out of contention for the final.

title: Russian general killed in explosion in Moscow
byline: A high-ranking general in the Russian armed forces has been killed in an explosion in Moscow.

title: Jaffna Hospital informs MP Archchuna he can only enter as a patient
byline: The Director’s Office of the Jaffna Teaching Hospital has notified MP Ramanathan Archchuna that he will only be allowed entry to the hospital as a patient, and for no other reason.

title: MP wants Doctor, Professor titles avoided in House
byline: MP Dilith Jayaweera proposed in Parliament that titles such as Doctor, Professor etc. should be avoided when introducing MPs in the House as it leads to social division.

title: IOC cuts funding to Sri Lanka over internal feud
byline: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) and the Olympic Committee of Asia (OCA) have raised concerns about the internal disputes of the National Olympic Committee of Sri Lanka (NOCSL), which have yet to be addressed and resolved properly.

title: Short-finned pilot whale found ashore near Bambalapitiya; cause unknown
byline: A short-finned pilot whale was found ashore near the beach close to the Bambalapitiya Railway Station last night, but the cause of its arrival on the coast has not yet been revealed, Marine Scientist Dr. Asha de Vos said.

title: Pope reveals he was target of suicide bomb attempt during 2021 Iraq visit
byline: Pope Francis has revealed he was the target of an attempted suicide bombing during his visit to Iraq three years ago, the first by a Catholic pontiff to the country and probably the riskiest foreign trip of his 11-year papacy.

title: Court orders to assess air quality in Jaffna
byline: The Court of Appeal today directed the Central Environmental Authority to assess the air quality in the Jaffna area and present its findings to the court.

title: SJB MP Kavinda’s ’’Dr.’’ title questioned in Parliament
byline: Claiming that no one can use the title of a medical doctor without being registered with the Sri Lanka Medical Council (SLMC) as per the Medical Ordinance, government MP Dr. Janaka Senaratne today challenged SJB MP Dr. Kavinda Jayawardena to produce his SLMC registration.

title: Only ministers, MPs have benefited most from President’s Fund: Govt.
byline: Former Ministers and MPs have disproportionately benefited from the President’s Fund, receiving financial assistance for medical treatment that goes beyond the fund’s original purpose, Parliament was informed today.

title: Buildings flattened as 7.3 magnitude earthquake hits Vanuatu
byline: A powerful 7.3 earthquake hit Vanuatu on Tuesday, sparking a network outage, crushing vehicles and damaging multiple buildings, including a complex in the capital Port Vila that hosts the diplomatic missions of Western nations including the United States.

title: NPP rules out need to evaluate educational qualifications of members: Govt. stands by its MPs
byline: The NPP government which is now a little over a month old has in recent weeks faced criticism over some of its members allegedly publicising fake doctor titles, receiving much flak on social media and among the citizens.
